events.message: The insured reported a collision involving their car with another vehicle at an intersection downtown.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident given the keywords related to vehicle collision and damages.
An agent specialized in auto insurance claims was assigned to handle this specific case promptly.
The insured was notified that their auto accident claim has been successfully received and logged.
The agent requested the submission of the police report, vehicle photos, and driver’s statement for review.
All requested documents including photos and police report were submitted by the insured promptly for processing.
The claims team initiated a thorough investigation including verification of accident circumstances and damages.
Investigation concluded with assessments confirming liability and evaluating the extent of vehicle damage.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to the insured based on assessment findings and policy coverage.
The insured expressed satisfaction with how their car accident claim had been handled and the proposed settlement.
The claim was formally approved for payment following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the customer.
Payment corresponding to the approved settlement was issued to the insured’s account without delay.
The auto accident claim was successfully closed after payment completion and customer confirmation.
All records related to the case were archived in the system for future reference and audit purposes.
